intro: Perymenium oaxacanum, commonly known as the Oaxaca peritoneum, is a lesser-known plant species native to the highlands of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its sprawling vines and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals, and it produces small, green fruits that mature to a reddish color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
